fluff.name: The Monk
entries: The young man took a deep breath and steadied himself as the ogre charged him. Thinking back to his training he prepared to counter the incoming blow. As the ogre's club struck the dirt where he had been only moments before, the young man drew upon his reservoir of spiritual power and let fly a flurry of blows upon the unsuspecting beast. Before the hulking ogre realized what had happened, it lay stunned in the mud. Hopefully, when the ogre regained consciousness it would think twice before raiding the local homesteads.

Moving silently through the darkness of the moonless night, a squad of hobgoblin assassins approached the tent of the enemy general. Trained in Martial Arts from birth, the lethal warriors slew the enemy guards without a sound. As the general stirred from sleep, his eyed widened as the hobgoblins seemed to appear from the darkness itself. He tried to call for help, but no sound came from his mouth as his life was ruthlessly snuffed out by the assassins. As quietly as they had arrived, the dark hobgoblin assassins disappeared into the night.

The Grand Master stepped forward to block the pass. As her students reluctantly fled into the mountains, she studied the horde of goblins that would soon be upon her. Though she was the most powerful living Wu Jen master, even in her prime she could not hope to slay half this many foes. She dropped her cloak from her shoulders, and her tattoos glistened with elemental magic as she prepared to bring down the mountain itself down upon her. Though she would most certainly perish, the pass would be blocked, and most importantly, her students would be able to escape.

entries.name: Mastery of Body and Mind
entries: Where most warriors strive for physical perfection, monks spend their lives training both their body and mind to work together. When both aspects of themselves are mastered, a monk is able to channel the life giving spiritual energy within themselves, their ki. Drawing upon this hidden power, these reclusive warriors can perform supernatural physical feats.

Looking always inward, monks often eschew any material possession they cannot carry on their backs, instead focusing on immaterial wealth. Whether enlightenment, happiness, challenging foes, or tests of might, all monks usually have an ideal or goal that they are constantly striving toward.

entries.name: Mystic Asceticism
entries: Often trained in hidden monasteries or by reclusive masters, monks must often give up any inheritance or titles in order to be accepted as monastic students. Some grand masters even require years of servitude and dedication to the monastery before they will even begin to train a new pupil. Once begun, a monks training does not stop until they die. They put all of their heart, mind, and soul in their quest for a perfect self.

Even the greatest monastic masters will sometimes seek out other monasteries, entering as a novice, even in old age. The quest for perfection is never ending, and despite great spiritual progress, the greatest view themselves as novices, eager to progress on the next step to enlightenment.

entries.name: Creating Your Monk
entries: When you create your monk, consider who instructed you in the ways of martial arts, and what they gave up in order to become a student. Were you an orphan left on the steps of a mountain monastery, raised from birth as a student of the Eternal Mountain technique? Or were you the lesser child of a noble family who gave up everything in order to learn the Shadow Arts in a quest for vengeance? Whatever the reason for your training, consider why you left a life of solitude and introspection for the dangerous life of an adventurer.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a monk quickly by using these suggestions. First, make Dexterity your highest ability score, followed by your Constitution if you wish to focus on physical power, or your Wisdom if you wish to focus on spiritual enlightenment. Second, choose either the {@background acolyte} or the {@background hermit} background.

classFeature.name: Martial Arts
entries: You honed your body itself into a weapon, mastering multiple styles of martial arts. For the purposes of your monk abilities, Martial Arts attacks are your unarmed strikes, and attacks with melee weapons without the heavy or special properties.
Beginning at 1st level, so long as you are not wearing heavy armor, wielding a shield, or wielding a heavy weapon, your Martial Arts attacks gains the benefits listed below:

items: You can use your Dexterity, in place of Strength, for the attack and damage rolls or your Martial Arts attacks.

You can roll your Martial Arts die in place of the normal damage of a Martial Arts attack. This die starts out as a {@dice d6} and changes as you gain monk levels, as indicated in the Martial Arts column of the Monk table above.
When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn and make a Martial Arts attack, you can use your bonus action on that same turn to make a single unarmed strike attack.

entries: Some styles of Martial Arts make use of exotic weapons like nunchaku ({@item club|phb|clubs}), kamas ({@item sickle|phb|sickles}), or sai ({@item dagger|phb|daggers}).

classFeature.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: You have trained to defend yourself from deadly blows even when unarmored. Starting at 1st level, so long as you aren't wearing armor and not wielding a shield, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

classFeature.name: Ki
entries: At 2nd level, you learn to manipulate the spiritual energy that resides within you, known as Ki. You can draw on your Ki to perform supernatural physical feats known as Techniques.

entries.name: Ki Point
entries: Your inner reserve of Ki is represented by a pool of Ki Points. This pool has a total number of Ki Points equal to your monk level + your Wisdom modifier. You regain expended Ki Points when you finish a short or long rest, so long as you spent at least 30 minutes of that rest in spiritual meditation.

entries.name: Techniques Known
entries: At 2nd level, you learn three {@filter Techniques|optionalfeatures|feature type=LLAM:T} of your choice from the list at the end of this class description. The Monk table shows when you learn more Techniques of your choice. Each time you gain a monk level, you can choose a Technique you know and replace it with another Technique of your choice.

entries.name: Saving Throws
entries: Techniques rely on your mastery of body and spirit, and grow in proportion to your self-control. When a Technique requires a saving throw, its saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

classFeature.name: Flurry of Blows
entries: You can draw on your spiritual power to strike with blinding speed. Starting at 2nd level, when you take the Attack action and make a Martial Arts attack, you can spend 1 Ki Point to make two unarmed strikes as a bonus action on that turn.

classFeature.name: Unarmored Movement
entries: Your pursuit of physical perfection has awakened the hidden potential of your body. At 2nd level, your speed increases by 10 feet so long as you are not wearing armor or a shield.
This speed bonus increases as you gain levels, as indicated in the Unarmored Movement column of the Monk table.

classFeature.name: Monastic Tradition
entries: At 3rd level, choose one of the following Monastic Traditions that best represents your training and philosophy as a monk: the Ways of the Drunken Fist, the Open Hand, Radiance, the Reaper, the Shadow Arts, the Wu Jen, or the Wuxia each of which is detailed at the end of this class.
The Monastic Tradition you choose grants you features at 3rd level, and again when you reach 6th, 10th, and 17th level.

entries.name: Signature Techniques
entries: Each Monastic Tradition has a list of Signature Techniques that you learn at the monk levels as noted in your Tradition's description. These Techniques don't count against your total number of Techniques Known and they cannot be replaced with other Techniques when you gain a level in this class.

classFeature.name: Deflect Missiles
entries: At 3rd level, when you are hit by a ranged weapon attack, you can use your reaction to attempt to catch the projectile. Reduce the damage by an amount equal to your Monk level + one roll of your Martial Arts die + your Dexterity modifier. If you reduce the damage to zero, you catch the projectile in a free hand.
If you catch the projectile, you can make a ranged (20/60) Martial Arts attack with that projectile as part of the same reaction. You are proficient with this ranged weapon attack.
Beginning at 10th level, you can spend 1 Ki Point to use this reaction whenever you are hit by a spell attack.

classFeature.name: Slow Fall
entries: At 4th level, you move through the air as light as a feather. Any falling damage you would take is reduced by an amount equal to five times your Monk level, so long as you are conscious.

classFeature.name: Monastic Tradition Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Monastic Tradition.

classFeature.name: Monastic Tradition Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Monastic Tradition.

classFeature.name: Monastic Tradition Feature
entries: At 17th level, you gain a feature granted by your Monastic Tradition.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Enlightened Fist
entries: Your spirit empowers your strikes. Upon reaching 6th level, your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to non-magical attacks.

classFeature.name: Spirit of Tranquility
entries: Beginning at 9th level, you can draw upon your spiritual vitality to bolster your physical and mental defenses. When you are forced to make a saving throw, you can spend 1 Ki Point to add your Wisdom modifier to the result of your roll.

classFeature.name: Purity of Body
entries: Your mastery over your body protects you from physical ailments. Beginning at 13th level, you are immune to all disease and the {@condition poisoned} condition.

classFeature.name: Ki Adept
entries: You have mastered favored Ki Techniques. Starting at 11th level, once on your turn, you can use a Technique you know that costs 1 Ki Point, or Flurry of Blows without spending Ki.

classFeature.name: Evasion
entries: Starting at 7th level, your instinctive agility lets you dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a black dragon's acid breath or a {@spell lightning bolt} spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

classFeature.name: Purity of Mind
entries: Starting at 14th level, if you are {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} when you start your turn, you can spend 1 Ki Point to instantly end either the {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} condition for yourself.

classFeature.name: Timeless Body
entries: Beginning at 15th level, you have detached yourself from the desires of the flesh. You no longer require food or water and you suffer none of the frailty of old age. Additionally, for every 10 years that pass your body ages only 1 year.

classFeature.name: Purity of Spirit
entries: You have gained such mastery over your spirit that you can meditate even while performing other simple actions. At 20th level, if you spend 10 minutes meditating or performing only light activities, such as traveling, eating, talking, or exploring, you regain all of your expended Ki Points. You may do this once per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Become the Teapot
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee Martial Arts attack, you can spend 1 Ki Point to stunt its mobility and force it to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is reduced to zero until the beginning of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Effortless Step
entries: The air around you works in unison with your movements, rising you up as you jump. Your jump height and distance are doubled (quadrupled with Step of the Wind) and you gain advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks related to jumping.

optionalfeature.name: Enduring Mountain Stance
entries: Your body and mind becomes as rigid and unyielding as the ground below you. Your ki roots your feet into the ground and you become immovable. When you use the {@action Dodge} action, you cannot be moved, pushed, {@condition grappled}, {@condition frightened}, or knocked {@condition prone} against your will until the start of your next turn, even if magically compelled to do so. You must be standing on the ground to use this ability.

optionalfeature.name: Fangs of the Fire Snake
entries: Your arms and legs become enveloped in roaring gouts of flame. When you make an unarmed attack on your turn, you can choose to strike out tendrils of flames which stretch out beyond your normal reach. Your reach increases by 5 feet for that attack, and it deals fire damage instead of bludgeoning damage. If the attack hits you can spend 1 ki point to deal an extra {@dice 1d10} fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Fang of the Frost Wolf
entries: You summon a shard of razor-sharp ice and fling it at your foe. You can spend 1 ki point to cast {@spell ice knife|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: Fist of Four Thunders
entries: You slam your fists together in front of you, causing a thunderous boom that blows away everything around you. You can spend 1 ki point to cast {@spell thunderwave}.

optionalfeature.name: Fangs of Unbroken Air
entries: You summon a swirling wind and concentrate it around your fist. When you make an unarmed attack on your turn, you can choose to strike out condensed bursts of air which stretch out beyond your normal reach. Your reach increases by 10 feet for that attack. If the attack hits you can spend 1 ki point to force the target to make a Strength saving throw or be pushed back 10 feet and be knocked {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Golden Snake's Icy Path
entries: Whenever you take the {@action Dash} action, until the end of your turn for any movement you make along a surface you can leave a trail of slippery ice. This ice counts as difficult terrain and lasts until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Rumbling Badger
entries: You shake the ground, causing a tremor that knocks over your foes. You can spend 1 ki point to cast {@spell earth tremor|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: Rush of Gale Spirits
entries: You send a blast of air outward with a thrust of your open palm. You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell gust of wind}.

optionalfeature.name: Shape the Raincloud
entries: You can spend 1 ki point to cast {@spell create or destroy water}.

optionalfeature.name: Sweeping Cinder Strike
entries: With a wide sweeping gesture, you summon forth a barrage of hot cinders. You can spend 1 ki point to cast {@spell burning hands}.

optionalfeature.name: Water Whip
entries: You summon a long, rubbery whip of pure water that you grip by one end. You can spend 1 ki point as a bonus action to create a whip of water that shoves and pulls a creature to unbalance it. A creature that you can see that is within 30 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes bludgeoning damage equal to your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier, plus an extra {@dice 1d10} bludgeoning damage for each additional ki point you spend, and you can either knock it {@condition prone} or pull it up to 25 feet closer to you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and you don't pull it or knock it {@condition prone}. You can't use Water Whip and cast a spell during the same turn.

optionalfeature.name: A Leaf on the Wind
entries: A powerful wind rises up to catch you as you fall. Your Slow Fall negates all falling damage regardless of distance. When you use the Slow Fall ability, you may also glide along the air to move 5 feet in any horizontal direction for every 5 feet that you fall.

optionalfeature.name: Burning Ember Flourish
entries: You reach out with your ki to snuff out a source of fire, causing it to go out with a bang or to sputter black smoke. You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell pyrotechnics|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: Crushing Hand of the Mountain
entries: You focus your strength into your outstretched fist, summoning a hand of earth from the ground. You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell Maximilian's earthen grasp|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: Curtain of Unyielding Wind
entries: You let out a fierce howl as a mighty wind begins swirling around you. You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell warding wind|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: Gong of the Summit
entries: You strike the air as if it were a gong. You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell shatter}.

optionalfeature.name: Hatchling's Flame
entries: You focus your ki into a torrent of fire that streaks away from you. You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell Aganazzar's scorcher|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: Impenetrable Iron Tortoise
entries: You summon an earthen barrier to defend yourself or an ally. As a reaction, you may spend 2 ki points to use your Deflect Missiles ability against an attack you can see within 30 feet of you. Any damage not prevented by this ability is taken by the original target of the attack. If you reduce the damage to 0, you can't make an attack with it.

optionalfeature.name: Mote of the Sun
entries: Your ki manifests as a roaring orb of fire. You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell flaming sphere}.

optionalfeature.name: Patient Badger Listens
entries: You reach out with your ki to the ground beneath you. You can spend 2 ki points as a bonus action to gain tremorsense with a range of 30 feet and a burrow speed equal to half of your walking speed for up to 1 minute. Your movement leaves behind a tunnel that remains for as long as this ability is active, and then collapses.

optionalfeature.name: Red Dragon's Claws
entries: Rays of fire spring from your outstretched hand to sear your foes. You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell scorching ray}.

optionalfeature.name: Swarming Ice Rabbit
entries: A flurry of magic snowballs erupts from a point you choose within range. You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell Snilloc's snowball swarm|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: Water Jet
entries: You can spend 2 ki points as an action to unleash a jet of water in a line that is 30 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a Strength saving throw, taking bludgeoning damage equal to your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, you can move each target that fails its saving throw to any unoccupied space touching the line.

optionalfeature.name: Dance of Three Ways
entries: You summon six spheres of earth from the ground, suspend them in the air around you, and ignite them with your fiery ki. With a thought, you launch these blazing meteors at your foe. You can spend 3 ki points to cast {@spell Melf's minute meteors|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: Earth Reaches for Sky
entries: Focusing your strength with a deep, rumbling shout, you swing your arms up high, causing an eruption of churned earth and stone that engulfs your foes. You can spend 3 ki points to cast {@spell erupting earth|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: Eternal Mountain Defense
entries: Your body hardens to stone, nearly impervious to weapons. You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell stoneskin}, targeting yourself.

optionalfeature.name: Flames of the Phoenix
entries: With a hand motion, you conjure a tiny bead of burning energy. You spend 3 ki points to cast {@spell fireball}.

optionalfeature.name: Fist of the Elements
entries: The elements swirl around your weapon. You can spend 3 ki points to cast {@spell elemental weapon}, choosing from only the damage types cold, fire, or thunder. Your unarmed strikes count as a weapon for the purposes of this discipline.

optionalfeature.name: Hua's Water Prison
entries: You conjure up a sphere of water that engulfs and imprisons foes that touch its surface. You can spend 4 ki to cast {@spell watery sphere|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: Mist Stance
entries: A swirling mist envelopes your body and you merge with it, becoming a cloud. You can spend 3 ki points to cast {@spell gaseous form}, targeting yourself.

optionalfeature.name: One with the Tides
entries: You reach out with your ki and become one with water. You spend 2 ki points as an action to gain underwater adaptations for 8 hours. While this ability is active, you can breath normally underwater, you gain a swim speed equal to your walking speed, and you gain blindsight with a radius of 60 feet while underwater.

optionalfeature.name: Rain of the Frigid Glacier
entries: You cool the air in the skies above you, condensing the water droplets into freezing rain and sleet. You can spend 3 ki points to cast {@spell sleet storm}.

optionalfeature.name: Raise the Troubled Earth
entries: You stir the earth around you into action, summoning a wall of sand to serve as your barricade. You can spend 3 ki to cast {@spell wall of sand|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: Raise the Still Waters
entries: Though water can give way easily, it can just as easily offer great resistance. You can spend 3 ki to cast {@spell wall of water|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: Ride the Wind
entries: You summon a mighty wind that envelopes your body, sweeping you to where you want to go. You spend 3 ki points to cast {@spell fly}, targeting yourself, except your fly speed is equal to your movement speed.

optionalfeature.name: River of Hungry Flame
entries: You sweep your hands upward, causing a wall of blazing hot fire to leap up from the ground. You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell wall of fire}.

optionalfeature.name: Sea's Fury
entries: You conjure up a mighty wave of water that crashes down on your foes. You can spend 3 ki to cast {@spell tidal wave|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: Shape of the Flowing River
entries: You touch the body of water with your ki, coaxing it to change its form. You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell control water}.

optionalfeature.name: Spellfist Stance
entries: You effortlessly flow between martial and elemental assault. When you use your action to use an elemental discipline, you can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action, or you can use your Flurry of Blows.

optionalfeature.name: Avatar of the Elements
entries: As an ultimate display of your mastery of the elements, you can spend 5 ki as an action to have the elements of earth, fire, air, and water form a protective sphere around your body, gaining multiple benefits for 1 minute. While this ability is active, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, cold, fire, lightning, and thunder damage. You also gain a burrow, fly, and swim speed equal to your movement speed. Lastly, you can use any of the following abilities as a bonus action:

items: You create a small earthquake on the ground in a 15-foot radius around you. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}.

You create a line of fire 15 feet long and 5 feet wide extending from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 3d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

You create a 15-foot cube of swirling wind centered on a point you can see within 60 feet of you. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 1d10} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a Large or smaller creature fails the save, that creature is also pushed up to 10 feet away from the center of the cube.

You create a 15-foot cone of ice shards extending from your outstretched hand in a direction you choose. Each creature in the cone must make a Constitution save throw. A creature takes {@dice 2d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails its save against this effect has its speed halved until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Breath of Winter
entries: You inhale deeply and then exhale, blasting a cone of frigid air out in front of you that freezes everything in its path. You can spend 5 ki points to cast {@spell cone of cold}.

optionalfeature.name: Eyes of Fire
entries: Your foes may try to hide in darkness, but their ki lights up like a torch to you. You may cast {@spell see invisibility} without expending any ki. In addition, while under the effects of {@spell see invisibility}, you may spend 2 ki points as a bonus action to gain truesight until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Eye of the Hurricane
entries: You stretch out your ki to embrace the winds. You can spend 5 ki points to cast {@spell control winds|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: Mold of the Mountain
entries: You master the many forms that earth may take. You can spend 5 ki to cast {@spell transmute rock|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: Swirling Crab's Revenge
entries: Your ki manifests as a swirling pool of water, smashing and pulling your foes towards its center. You can spend 5 ki points to cast {@spell maelstrom|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: Wave of Rolling Earth
entries: The ground shakes and emits a low rumble as a wall of stone erupts up into being. You can spend 5 ki points to cast {@spell wall of stone}.

optionalfeature.name: Dark Flash
entries: When a creature you can see hits you with a melee attack, you can force it to make a Wisdom saving throw against your Technique Save DC. On a failure, you take no damage from its attack, and it takes the damage of its attack + your Monk level.

optionalfeature.name: Critical Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a Marital Arts attack, you can read the proportions of its body to strike its weak point. This attack becomes a critical hit, regardless of your d20 roll.

optionalfeature.name: Divergent Strike
entries: When you score a critical hit against a creature with a Martial Arts attack, you can use a bonus action on that same turn to force it to make a Constitution saving throw against your Technique Save DC. On a failed save, it takes bludgeoning damage equal to four rolls of your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Mystical Shift
entries: As a bonus action, you can clap your hands together, instantly switching places with a creature you can see within 30 feet. An unwilling creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your Technique Save DC to resist this effect.

optionalfeature.name: Residual Reader
entries: As an action, you open your senses to sinister energy around you. For the next 10 minutes, you can sense the presence of any fiend or undead creature within 30 feet of you.

optionalfeature.name: Spiritual Transfiguration
entries: As an action, you can cast {@spell alter self} without expending a spell slot. When cast in this way, it does not require concentration.

optionalfeature.name: Turn Undead
entries: As an action, you speak a prayer censuring the undead. Each undead that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is Turned, as if by the Cleric's Channel Divinity, for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

optionalfeature.name: Arresting Strike
entries: When you hit a target with a weapon attack, you can expend one Exploit Die and force it to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it takes bonus damage equal to one roll of your Exploit Die and its speed is 0 until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Crippling Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee Martial Arts attack, you can spend 1 Ki Point to cripple its senses and force the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target is either {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, or unable to speak (your choice) until the beginning of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Empowered Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee Martial Arts attack, you can spend 1 Ki Point to strike with great power and force the target to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it is knocked back from in a straight line a number of feet equal to five times your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 5 feet), where it falls {@condition prone}. A creature that is at least one size larger than you has advantage on its saving throw to resist this effect.

optionalfeature.name: Mystic Healing
entries: You can draw on your Ki to stimulate natural healing. As an action, you can spend 2 Ki Points to regain hit points equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Patient Defense
entries: You quiet your spirit, entering a defensive stance to better defend against incoming blows. You can spend 1 Ki Point to take the {@action Dodge} action as a bonus action on your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Step of the Wind
entries: You move with the speed of the wind. You can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action. When you do so, your jump distance is doubled until the end of your current turn.

optionalfeature.name: Gentling Touch
entries: In place of an attack, you can expend 1 Ki Point and touch a creature, and manipulate its Ki to put it to sleep. Roll your Martial Arts die five times. If the target's remaining hit points are less than or equal to the amount you rolled, it instantly falls {@condition unconscious} for 10 minutes. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or another creature uses an action to wake it.
You can expend additional Ki Points (up to your Wisdom modifier) to empower this Technique, rolling an additional Martial Arts die for each additional Ki Point you spend.

optionalfeature.name: Seeking Strike
entries: Your spirit will guide your strikes when your body fails. When you miss with a Martial Arts attack, you can spend 1 Ki Point to re-roll your attack. You must use the new result.

optionalfeature.name: Slowing Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee Martial Arts attack, you can spend 1 Ki Point to interrupt their Ki flow, forcing the target to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature suffers the effects of the {@spell slow} spell until the start of your next turn. You do not need to concentrate on this effect.

optionalfeature.name: Stunning Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee Martial Arts attack, you can spend 1 Ki Point to strike with relentless force, forcing it to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition stunned} until the beginning of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Aura Sight
entries: You can reach out with your Ki to sense your surroundings. You gain blindsight with a range of 20 feet. Within that range, you can see anything that isn't behind total cover, even if you are blinded or in darkness. You can see invisible creatures in that range unless the creature successfully hides from you
As you gain levels in this class the range of this blindsight increases; at 13th level (30 feet) and 18th level (60 feet).

optionalfeature.name: Heavenly Step
entries: You can move along vertical surfaces, across liquids, and upside down on ceilings without falling during the move.
If you end your movement on a vertical surface, liquid, or upside down on a ceiling, you can spend 1 Ki Point to remain in place without falling until the beginning of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Indomitable Spirit
entries: You can augment your physical abilities with spiritual power. When you make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check you can spend 1 Ki Point to add your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1) to your roll. You can use this Technique after you roll.

optionalfeature.name: Armor of the Ascetic
entries: You exude an aura of peace. At the end of a short or long rest, you gain the effects of {@spell sanctuary}, which lasts until the start of your next short or long rest. This spell ends early as normal.

optionalfeature.name: Mystical Integrity
entries: Your sense of self and strength of your will are unshakable. You are immune to any spell or effect that would alter your form or force you to teleport, unless you wish to be affected.

optionalfeature.name: Mantle of Courtesy
entries: You gain proficiency in Persuasion, and whenever you make a Charisma (Persuasion) check, you gain a bonus to your roll equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).

optionalfeature.name: Tongue of Sun and Moon
entries: You can touch the Ki of other minds and communicate with any creature that speaks language. Creatures that speak no languages can communicate and understand simple ideas.

optionalfeature.name: Empty Body
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can spend 4 Ki Points to become invisible for 1 minute. While invisible in this way, you gain resistance to all damage except for force damage.
You can also spend 8 Ki Points to cast {@spell astral projection}, without needing material components. When you do so, you target only yourself and can't take other creatures with you.

optionalfeature.name: Quivering Palm
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee Martial Arts attack, you can spend 5 Ki Points to infuse its spirit with imperceptible vibrations, which last for a maximum number of days equal to your monk level. So long as you and the creature are on the same plane of existence, you can use your action to end these vibrations, forcing the creature to make a Constitution saving throw. It is reduced to 0 hit points on a failed save and takes {@damage 10d10} necrotic damage on a successful save.
You can have only one creature under the effect of this feature at a time and using this feature on another target harmlessly ends the effects on any other creatures.

optionalfeature.name: Improvised Strikes
entries: You are adept at fighting with whatever is at hand. You gain proficiency with improvised weapons, they count as Martial Arts attacks for you, and you can use your Dexterity, in place of Strength, for improvised weapon attack and damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Spiritual Armor
entries: You can reinforce your body with spiritual power. As a bonus action, you can spend 1 Ki Point to grant yourself temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).
The first time a creature deals damage to these temporary hit points, you can use your reaction to cause it to take force damage equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die.

optionalfeature.name: Whirling Strike
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 Ki Point to strike out and force every creature within your reach to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they take bludgeoning damage equal to your Martial Arts die + your Dexterity modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Adept Fighting Style
entries: You have trained in a specialized style of fighting. You gain a {@filter Fighting Style from those available to Monk (Alternate)|optionalfeatures|feature type=fs:am}. As a monk, you can only gain one Fighting Style through this Technique.

optionalfeature.name: Archery
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls with ranged weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Blind Warrior
entries: You have blindsight with a range in feet equal to 5 times your proficiency bonus. In that range, you can see invisible targets and anything that isn't behind total cover or hidden from you.
You also have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on your sense of hearing beyond this radius.

optionalfeature.name: Defensive Fighting
entries: While wearing armor or wielding a shield, you gain a +1 bonus to your Armor Class.

optionalfeature.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with it.

optionalfeature.name: Featherweight Fighting
entries: While you are wielding only light weapons, and nothing else your speed increases by 10 feet. You also gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls with light weapons, so long as you are not wearing medium or heavy armor, or wielding a shield.

optionalfeature.name: Protector
entries: When a creature you can see attacks you, or a target within 5 feet, you can use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to the target's Armor Class against that attack. You must be wielding a shield or a melee weapon to gain this benefit.

optionalfeature.name: Thrown Weapon Fighting
entries: You can draw a weapon that has the thrown property as part of the attack you make with the weapon. Moreover, when you hit with a ranged weapon attack using a thrown weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll of that attack.

optionalfeature.name: Wrestler
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee attack on your turn, you can use a bonus action on that turn to attempt to grapple or shove that creature, so long as you have a free hand to do so. Also, you can drag {@condition grappled} creatures up to your full speed.

optionalfeature.name: Crushing Strike
entries: When you hit with an unarmed strike, you can spend up to 3 Ki Points to empower your strike with deadly force and deal additional bludgeoning damage equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die per Ki Point spent.
You may only use this Technique once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: Divine Light
entries: You learn two {@filter cantrips of your choice|spells|class=Cleric|level=0}  from the Cleric spell list, and Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for them.

optionalfeature.name: Unyielding Perseverence
entries: You can draw upon your Ki to find success in times of great need. When you make an ability check or saving throw, you can spend any number of Ki Points and add +1 bonus to your roll for each Ki Point you spend. You can use this feature after you roll.

optionalfeature.name: Commune with Self
entries: You have gained the ability to contact the Ki of your previous lives to gain information. As an action, you can spend 5 Ki Points to enter a meditative state, which lasts for 10 minutes, and consult your previous lives. At the end of your meditation, you gain the same information as if you had cast {@spell commune}.

optionalfeature.name: Friend of Beast and Leaf
entries: You can enter a meditative state to commune your Ki with that of the natural world around you. As an action, you can spend 5 Ki Points to enter this meditative state, which lasts for 10 minutes. At the end of your meditation, you gain the same information as if you had cast {@spell commune with nature}.

optionalfeature.name: Monastic Fortitude
entries: As a reaction when you take damage, you can expend 2 Ki Points to reduce the incoming damage by an amount equal to two rolls of your Marital Arts die + your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Banishing Strike

foundrySystem.activation.condition: When you hit a creature with a melee Martial Arts attack

entries: When you hit a creature with a melee Martial Arts attack, you can expend 3 Ki Points to empower your blow with legendary force, and force the target to make a Charisma saving throw. It takes additional force damage equal to three rolls of your Martial Arts die on a failure, and half as much on a success.

If this attack reduces the target to 50 hit points of fewer, it shunted to a harmless demiplane where it is {@condition incapacitated}. The creature reappears in the unoccupied space nearest to the last space it occupied at the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Conjure Previous Life
entries: You can draw upon the Ki of your previous lives and summon a specter of a past life to come to your aid. As an action, you can spend 5 Ki Points to cast {@spell summon celestial|TCE} ({@creature celestial spirit|TCE|defender}) at 5th-level. When summoned, it has the following changes:

items: It is a Medium creature that resembles a humanoid monk, though it may not be the same race as you are.
Its Radiant Mace attacks resemble unarmed strikes.

When summoned you can infuse it with a number of Ki Points of your choice, and your Ki Point maximum is reduced by the same amount while it is summoned. It can use the infused Ki to use any Techniques you know.

optionalfeature.name: Awaken the Third Eye
entries: You can open your mind to the Ki that flows through all living things, allowing you to predict the actions of creatures before they happen. You can perform a 1 minute meditative ritual where you expend 8 Ki Points to cast {@spell foresight}, targeting only yourself. While this effect is active, your Ki Point maximum is reduced by 8. You can end this effect as an action.

optionalfeature.name: Word of Creation
entries: You can draw on your intimate knowledge of the Ki that flows through all things and speak a divine word of creation. As an action, you can spend 7 Ki Points to cast {@spell divine word}, using Wisdom as your spellcasting modifier.
Once you use your Ki to cast {@spell divine word}, you must finish a short or long rest before you can cast it in this way again.

feat.name: Ki Warrior
entries: You have studied and mastered monastic Techniques which allow you to perform supernatural feats of spiritual power.

items: You learn two {@filter Techniques|optionalfeatures|feature type=LLAM:T} from the Monk (Alternate) class. If the Technique has a prerequisite or mentions a Martial Arts die, you can learn it only if you are a Monk and you meet its prerequisites. If a Technique requires the target to make a saving throw to resist its effects, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier.

You gain 2 Ki Points to spend on {@filter Techniques|optionalfeatures|feature type=LLAM:T}. You regain all of your expended Ki Points when you finish a short or long rest. If you have Ki from another feature, these Ki Points are added to your total pool of Ki Points.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Storm Fist
entries: Storm Fists are monks who are in tune with the natural energy of ki, and can manifest it as strikes of thunder and lightning that augment their blows. These monks are high-flying martial artists who strike with the ferocity of a raging storm.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Fist Techniques
entries: {@i 3rd-level Storm Fist feature}
You learn certain Techniques at the levels noted in the table below. They don't count against your number of Techniques Known and they cannot be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Galvanic Form
entries: {@i 3rd-level Storm Fist feature}

Starting when you choose this Tradition, you can channel the fury of a storm into your strikes. The first time you hit a creature with a Martial Arts attack, the attack deals additional lightning damage equal to your Martial Arts die.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Step
entries: {@i 6th-level Storm Fist feature}

When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can use your bonus action to unleash the storm within. You may immediately move up to half your speed, without provoking opportunity attacks. If you end this movement within 5 feet of another creature, they take lightning damage equal to your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).
Additionally, you gain resistance to lightning damage.

subclassFeature.name: Lightning Reflexes
entries: {@i 10th-level Storm Fist feature}
You have trained the lightning in your body to enhance your reflexes. You may add your Wisdom modifier to any Dexterity check that you make (minimum of 1).
Additionally, when you throw a projectile you catch using Deflect Missiles, it deals additional lightning damage equal to your Martial Arts die.

subclassFeature.name: Thundercrash
entries: {@i 17th-level Storm Fist feature}

You may leap into the air and crash back down like the storm itself. As an action, you can spend 4 ki points to leap up to 90 feet in the air and crash down on a point you can see. All creatures within a 10-foot radius must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Technique Save DC or take {@damage 6d10} lightning damage, or half as much on a success.
Additionally, any creature currently in the space you choose to land in is pushed into an unoccupied space of your choice within 5 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Blind Monk
entries: This style is based around using different forms of sight than your eyes, and it is a fighting style that is heavily defensive. It will rely on fighting back or countering as you might call it to win fights rather than going all out at once. You also eventually learn that there's more to see without using your eyes than with them. You will become a great force to be reckoned with, even though some might underestimate you because of your handicap.

subclassFeature.name: Blind Techniques
entries: {@i 3rd-level Way of the Blind feature}
You learn certain Techniques at the levels noted in the table below. They don't count against your number of Techniques Known and they cannot be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Blind Style
entries: {@i 3rd-level Way of the Blind feature}

When you choose this archetype, you make the sacrifice of your own eyes if you already have not done so, or never had them in the first place. This means losing all current senses that rely on sight such as darkvision, and true sight. You can now focus all your ki into your other senses.
This makes it so that you possess a blindsight and Tremorsense of up to 15 feet, which increases at 9th level to 30 feet, and at 17th level to 60 feet.
While barefoot, your Tremorsense is doubled.
If you regain your vision, you're unable to focus your ki into your other senses thus losing the features of this subclass.
You also gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks based off hearing, and you can no longer become {@condition deafened}.

subclassFeature.name: Precise Footwork
entries: {@i 6th-level Way of the Blind feature}
You may pick one of these three benefits to always have active when you use your Patient Defense:

items: Once per turn, when a creature makes a melee attack against you with disadvantage, you can make one melee unarmed or melee monk weapon attack against it without using your reaction, if you are within range for an attack against the creature.
Once per turn, when an attack within your reach misses you, you can force the attacker to make a Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.
Once per round, when you take any damage, you can gain resistance to that damage before it is applied.

entries: You may pick one more of these benefits to always have active at 10th level, and have all three to always active at 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: Impenetrable Defense
entries: {@i 10th-level Way of the Blind feature}

Your senses have become heightened to near godlike levels, enhancing your combat capabilities. You can use Deflect Missiles on melee attacks that hit you or a creature within 5 feet of you but you don't get the option to throw the melee weapon.

When you use Patient Defense on your turn, you can Deflect Missiles up to two additional times without using a reaction. For every 'missile' deflected after the first, you cannot add your Monk level to the damage reduced and you cannot throw the 'projectile' back.

subclassFeature.name: Wushi Ki Strike
entries: {@i 17th-level Way of the Blind feature}

You have learned to punish those with the gift you've been given, and then some. When you hit an attack on a creature, you may expend 2 Ki points and they must make a Wisdom saving throw contested by your Technique Save DC. On a failed save, their body begins to shut down.

At the start of each of their turns, they gain 1 point of Wushi. While affected by this, they gain debuffs equal to the amount of Wushi points they have. At the end of each of their turns, they can roll a Wisdom saving throw. If they pass, they lose 1 point and don't make any more Wisdom saving throws. If they fail, nothing happens. They lose all stacks after they complete a long rest.

items: {@b 1: Taste.} They have disadvantage on ability checks.
{@b 2: Touch.} They can no longer hold weapons or make somatic components for spells.
{@b 3: Sight and Hearing.} They become {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened}.
{@b 4: Mind and Body.} They have disadvantage on all saving throws.
{@b 5: Soul and Spirit.} Their movement speed drops to 0 and they fall {@condition prone}.
{@b 6: Life and Death.} They are reduced to 0 hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Way of Devils
entries: Monks of the Way of Devils are part of an ancient and unholy order, one dedicated to serving the legions of devils in their war against the demons of the abyss, as well as serving their infernal masters' interests on the Material Plane. Whereas most monks train in the art of self-defense, those of the Way of Devils focus on inflicting punishment and controlling their enemies. It is said that the first of these monks were Duergar, newly bound into pacts with Asmodeus and willing to wield his devilish chains over the prospect of becoming chained themselves.

subclassFeature.name: Devils Techniques
entries: {@i 3rd-level Way of Devils feature}
You learn certain Techniques at the levels noted in the table below. They don't count against your number of Techniques Known and they cannot be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Devilish Chain
entries: {@i 3rd-level Way of Devils feature}

You gain the ability to summon a spectral, fiendish chain of burning iron to attack and bind your foes. Whenever you take the Attack action, you can summon the chain to your empty hand and use it for the attack. The chain uses the statistics of a whip, but with a reach of 15 feet, and it counts as a monk weapon for you. You can only have one chain summoned at a time. It disappears after 1 minute, if you are reduced to 0 hit points, or if you dismiss it early as a bonus action.

You can bind a whip you acquire to become your Devilish Chain. The ritual takes an hour to perform, and after the ritual is complete, the chosen item vanishes. Whenever you summon your Devilish Chain, you may summon the designated weapon instead, except its reach increases to 15 feet and you gain the other benefits of your Devilish Chain with it.

Additionally, whenever you hit a creature with your chain, you can spend 1 ki point to apply one of the following effects. You can only use one of these effects each time you make an attack with the chain.

entries.name: Binding Chain
entries: The creature must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature bound by the chain until the start of your next turn and cannot move more than 15 feet away from you. A creature bound by the chain can use its action to make a Strength saving throw, freeing itself on a success. While a creature is bound in this way, you cannot use the chain to make other attacks.

entries.name: Burning Chain
entries: You deal additional acid, cold, or fire damage (your choice when you use this feature) equal to one Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).

entries.name: Luring Chain
entries: If the creature is one size larger than you or smaller, you pull the creature up to 10 feet closer to you.

subclassFeature.name: Vile Edict
entries: {@i 6th-level Way of Devils feature}

You have learned to speak in the wicked tongue of the nine hells, compelling your foes to obey in and out of battle. As a bonus action, you can spend 1 ki point to cast the {@spell command} spell. The target has disadvantage on the saving throw if it is bound by your chain.

subclassFeature.name: Hellish Tether
entries: {@i 10th-level Way of Devils feature}

You can bind a foe to you in torturous turmoil. When you bind a target using the Binding Chain option from your Devilish Chain feature, you can spend an additional 2 ki points to change the duration of the binding effect to 1 minute. The creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. On a failed save, it takes acid, cold, or fire damage (your choice) equal to two rolls of your Martial Arts die.

subclassFeature.name: Fiendish Form
entries: {@i 17th-level Way of Devils feature}

Your commitment to the nine hells has been proven and you have been rewarded in kind. On your turn, you can spend 5 ki points as a bonus action to take on the qualities of a fiend for 1 minute. You can end these traits early as a bonus action.
While in your fiendish form, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain immunity to fire damage, and resistance to cold damage and bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered.
Your weapon attacks deal additional acid, cold, or fire damage (your choice) equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die.
You gain a flying speed equal to your current walking speed.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Exorcist
entries: One of the greatest threats to mortals of the material plane is that of demons, devils, and other extraplanar evil. To combat this existential threat, great sages founded monasteries that train martial artists specialized in hunting these evil spirits.

subclassFeature.name: Exorcist Techniques
entries: {@i 3rd-level Exorcist feature}
You learn certain Techniques at the levels noted in the table below. They don't count against your number of Techniques Known and they cannot be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Mystic Arts
entries: {@i 3rd-level Exorcist feature}

You have been taught to channel your Ki in wondrous ways in order to combat evil spirits, known as {@filter Mystic Arts|optionalfeatures|feature type=LLAM:MYA}. You learn Turn Undead and one other Mystic Art of your choice from the list of Mystic Arts.

You can use each of your Mystic Arts once at no cost, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you have no uses of a Mystic Art left, you can expend 3 Ki Points to use that Mystic Art one additional time.

Each time you gain a level in this class you can replace one Mystic Art you know (other then Turn Undead) with another Mystic Art of your choice. You learn one additional Mystic Art when you reach 6th, 10th, and 17th level in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Sorcerous Defense
entries: {@i 6th-level Exorcist feature}

Your training has granted you an increased resilience against malevolent spirits. You gain resistance to necrotic and poison damage, and whenever a fiend or undead forces you to make a saving throw, you have advantage on your roll.

subclassFeature.name: Exorcist's Domain
entries: {@i 10th-level Exorcist feature}

You can manifest your will in one of three different ways. You may change your domain when you level up. As an action you can manifest a special version of {@spell hallucinatory terrain} trapping friend and foe alike inside.

items: {@b Open Domain.} The spell's radius is set to 30 feet centered on you. Creatures you choose treat the area as difficult terrain, additionally, when you create this domain, creatures you choose take {@dice 2d4} radiant damage at the start of their turn. You can increase this damage by an additional {@dice 2d4} (up to {@dice 6d4}) per every 1 ki point spent.

{@b Closed Domain.} The spell's radius is set to 20 feet centered on you. The sphere is opaque and cannot be seen into or out of. Creatures of your choice treat the area as difficult terrain and if they attempt to leave or enter the domain they must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your Technique Save DC in order to do so. On a failed save a creature cannot attempt again until its next turn.

{@b Simple Domain.} The spell's radius is set to 10 feet centered on you. Attacks made against creatures you choose in this domain are considered to be at advantage. Additionally, creatures provoke an attack of opportunity if it moves out of the domain regardless of range and irregardless of whether you have a reaction available or not.

entries: Your Domain lasts for 1 minute, unless you end it as an action, you leave, or you are {@condition incapacitated}. Once you use this feature you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Grand Master Exorcist
entries: {@i 17th-level Exorcist feature}
You are a true master of the Mystic Arts. When you finish a short rest, you regain the use of one of your Mystic Arts.
Moreover, once per turn when you force a creature in your Exorcist's Domain to make a saving throw against a Mystic Art or Technique, you can impose disadvantage on its roll.
Finally, when you have no uses of your Exorcist's Domain left, you can expend 5 Ki Points to use it one additional time.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Zen Shot
entries: Monks that adopt this Tradition value determination above all else. Known for a near-supernatural mastery of the bow and arrow, these spiritual adepts spend years honing their senses and learning to enter the Zen State. This state of clear focus grants them wondrous accuracy with their weapon of choice.

subclassFeature.name: Zen Shot Techniques
entries: {@i 3rd-level Zen Shot feature}
You learn certain Techniques at the levels noted in the table below. They don't count against your number of Techniques Known and they cannot be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Monastic Precision
entries: {@i 3rd-level Zen Shot feature}
Your training has granted you unique skill not only with the bow, but with other graceful arts. You gain proficiency with longbows, and in Acrobatics and calligrapher's supplies.
Whenever you make either a Dexterity (Acrobatics) or a calligrapher's supplies check, you gain a bonus to your roll equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die.

subclassFeature.name: Zen State
entries: {@i 3rd-level Zen Shot feature}
You have learned to enter a state of spiritual focus known as the Zen State. As a bonus action, you can enter a Zen State, which grants you the following benefits for the duration:

items: You do not have disadvantage on ranged weapon attacks that you make at the weapon's long range.
You can use your Wisdom, in place of your Dexterity, for your ranged weapon attack and damage rolls.
When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a ranged weapon, you can re-roll the die. You must use this new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2.

entries: You can maintain this Zen State for up to 1 minute, and you must concentrate on it as if you were concentrating on a spell. The Zen State ends early if you lose your concentration, or if you choose to end it as a bonus action on your turn.
Once you enter a Zen State you must finish a short or long rest before you can do so again. When you have no uses of this feature left, you can expend 2 Ki Points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Reactive Defense
entries: {@i 6th-level Zen Shot feature}

When you are in your Zen State, and a creature targets you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to roll your Marital Arts die and add it to your Armor Class against that attack. Should the attack miss, you can move up to half your walking speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Flurry of Arrows
entries: {@i 10th-level Zen Shot feature}

Your skill with the bow allows you to rain arrows up on your foes. When you take the attack action and make only ranged weapon attacks while you are in a Zen State, you can make a single ranged weapon attack as a bonus action on that turn.
Moreover, your attack with ranged weapons score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.

subclassFeature.name: Master of the Zen Shot
entries: {@i 17th-level Zen Shot feature}

You are a true master of the Zen Shot, and it is rare that your arrows do not find their marks. You no longer need to be able to see the target of a ranged weapon attack, so long as it is in range and there is a straight path for the ammunition.
In addition, if you roll a 1 on the d20 for a ranged weapon attack roll while you are in your Zen State, you can reroll the d20, but you must use the new roll, even if it is another 1.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Four Elements
entries: You follow a monastic tradition that teaches you to harness the elements. When you focus your ki, you can align yourself with the forces of creation and bend the four elements to your will, using them as an extension of your body. Some members of this tradition dedicate themselves to a single element, but others weave the elements together.
Many monks of this tradition tattoo their bodies with representations of their ki powers, commonly imagined as coiling dragons, but also as phoenixes, fish, plants, mountains, and cresting waves.

entries.subclassFeature: Harmony of Fire and Water|Monk (Alternate)|LLAM|Four Elements (Re)|LLAM:E|3

subclassFeature.name: Initiate of the Way
entries: {@i 3rd-level Way of Four Elements feature}

When you choose this tradition at 3rd level, you learn how to manipulate the four elements in subtle ways. You learn three of the following cantrips: {@spell control flames|xge}, {@spell gust|xge}, {@spell mold earth|xge}, or {@spell shape water|xge}. You learn three additional cantrips from this list at 6th, 10th, and 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: Harmony of Fire and Water
entries: {@i 3rd-level Way of Four Elements feature}
When you're not in combat, you can have your inner spirit flow in harmony as an action. When you do, you regain half your Ki points (rounded down).
You may do this once per long rest before you can do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Disciple of the Elements
entries: {@i 3rd-level Way of Four Elements feature}
You learn magical disciplines that harness the power of the four elements. Some disciplines require you to spend ki points when you use them.

You learn two elemental disciplines of your choice, which are detailed in {@filter Elemental Disciplines|optionalfeatures|feature type=LLAM:FER}. You learn two additional elemental disciplines of your choice at 6th, 10th, and 17th level.
Whenever you learn a new elemental discipline, you can also replace one elemental discipline that you already know with a different discipline.

{@bold Casting Elemental Spells.} Some elemental disciplines allow you to cast spells. See chapter 10 of the Player's Handbook for the general rules of spellcasting. To cast one of these spells, you use its casting time and other rules, but you don't need to provide material components for it. When you cast a spell with a discipline, it is cast at the spell's lowest level unless otherwise specified.

Once you reach 5th level in this class, you can spend additional ki points to increase the level of an elemental discipline spell that you cast, provided that the spell has an enhanced effect at a higher level, as {@spell burning hands} does. The spell's level increases by 1 for each additional ki point you spend. For example, if you are a 5th-level monk and use Sweeping Cinder Strike to cast {@spell burning hands}, you can spend 2 ki points to cast it as a 2nd-level spell (the discipline's base cost of 1 ki point plus 1).

The maximum number of ki points (its base ki point cost plus any additional points) that you can spend on the spell is 2, unless a discipline specifies otherwise. This maximum increases to 3 at 9th level, 4 at 13th level, and 5 at 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: 6th Level Elemental Disciplines
entries: {@i 6th-level Way of Four Elements feature}
You learn two more elemental disciplines of your choice at 6th level.

subclassFeature.name: 10th Level Elemental Disciplines
entries: {@i 10th-level Way of Four Elements feature}
You learn two more elemental disciplines of your choice at 10th level.

subclassFeature.name: 17th Level Elemental Disciplines
entries: {@i 17th-level Way of Four Elements feature}
You learn two more elemental disciplines of your choice at 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Cobalt Soul
entries: Driven by the pursuit of knowledge and its scholars' worship of {@deity The Knowing Mentor|Exandria|TDCSR}, the {@book Library of the Cobalt Soul|TDCSR|2|Library of the Cobalt Soul} is one of the best-respected and most heavily guarded repositories of tomes, history, and information in all Exandria. People from all lands come to the library to seek knowledge, and those particularly dedicated to the virtues of truth often pledge their minds and bodies to the {@book Cobalt Soul's|TDCSR|2|Library of the Cobalt Soul} cause. To become a member of the {@book Cobalt Soul|TDCSR|2|Library of the Cobalt Soul} is to give oneself over to a quest dedicated to unveiling life's mysteries, bringing light to the secrets of concealed evil, and guarding the most powerful and dangerous of truths from those whose unwholesome thirst for knowledge might bring death and suffering to others.

The monks of the {@book Cobalt Soul|TDCSR|2|Library of the Cobalt Soul} are the embodiment of the maxim: "Know your enemy." Through tireless research, they steel themselves against the unrelenting tides of evil. Through rigorous training, they learn to break through their foes' mental and physical defenses. Then, once the fight is done, they record their findings for future generations of monks to study.

subclassFeature.name: Cobalt Soul Techniques
entries: {@i 3rd-level Cobalt Soul feature}
You learn certain Techniques at the levels noted in the table below. They don't count against your number of Techniques Known and they cannot be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Extract Aspects
entries: {@i 3rd-level Cobalt Soul feature}

You can strike pressure points to intuit crucial information about a foe. When you hit a creature with one of the attacks granted by your Flurry of Blows, you can analyze it. Whenever an analyzed creature misses you with an attack, you can immediately use your reaction to make an unarmed strike against that creature if it's within your reach. This benefit lasts until you finish a {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|short or long rest}.
Additionally, when you analyze a creature, you learn all of its damage vulnerabilities, damage resistances, damage immunities, and condition immunities.

subclassFeature.name: Extort Truth
entries: {@i 6th-level Cobalt Soul feature}

You can precisely strike a hidden cluster of nerves on a creature, temporarily preventing it from masking its true thoughts and intent. When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can spend 1 ki point to force it to make a Charisma {@quickref saving throws|PHB|2|1|saving throw}. On a failed save, the creature is unable to speak a deliberate lie, and all Charisma checks directed at the creature are made with {@quickref Advantage and Disadvantage|PHB|2|0|advantage} for up to 10 minutes. You know if it succeeded or failed on its {@quickref saving throws|PHB|2|1|saving throw}.

An affected creature is aware of the effect and can thus avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive in its answers as long as the effect lasts.
If you wish to impose this effect on a creature without injuring it, you can attack the creature to simply touch it, dealing no damage on a hit.

subclassFeature.name: Mystical Erudition
entries: {@i 6th-level Cobalt Soul feature}

You have extensively studied the history and lore within the archives of the {@book Cobalt Soul|TDCSR|2|Library of the Cobalt Soul}. You learn one language of your choice, and you gain proficiency with one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Religion}. If you already have proficiency in one of the listed skills, you can instead choose to double your proficiency bonus for any ability check you make that uses the chosen proficiency.

subclassFeature.name: Mind of Mercury
entries: {@i 10th-level Cobalt Soul feature}

You've honed your awareness and reflexes through mental aptitude and pattern recognition. Once per turn, if you've already taken your reaction, you may spend 1 ki point to take an additional reaction. You can use only one reaction per triggering effect.

subclassFeature.name: Mystical Erudition (10th Level)
entries: {@i 10th-level Cobalt Soul feature}

You gain an additional language and an additional skill proficiency from the list: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Religion}—(or you can double the bonus of an existing proficiency from the list) at 10th level.

subclassFeature.name: Debilitating Barrage
entries: {@i 17th-level Cobalt Soul feature}

Upon reaching 17th level, you've gained the knowledge to manipulate a creature's ki to undermine their fortitude. When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can spend 3 ki points to cause the creature to gain vulnerability to one damage type of your choice for 1 minute, or until the end of a turn in which it has taken damage of that type.

If a creature has resistance to the damage type you choose, this resistance is suppressed for 1 minute, rather than gaining vulnerability. A creature that is immune to the damage type you choose is unaffected. A creature who is affected by this feature cannot be affected by it again for 24 hours.

subclassFeature.name: Mystical Erudition (17th Level)
entries: {@i 17th-level Cobalt Soul feature}

You gain an additional language and an additional skill proficiency from the list: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Religion}—(or you can double the bonus of an existing proficiency from the list) at 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Oni
entries: Oni, vicious demons of the ancient world that prey upon the blood of innocents. As a student of this Tradition, one such vile creature has been sealed within you. You have been taught to draw on this creature's sinister power in order to empower your own abilities and use its Ki for noble ends.

subclassFeature.name: Oni Techniques
entries: {@i 3rd-level Oni feature}
You learn certain Techniques at the levels noted in the table below. They don't count against your number of Techniques Known and they cannot be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Infernal Form
entries: {@i 3rd-level Oni feature}

You have learned to channel the infernal Ki sealed within your soul. As a bonus action, you can take on your Infernal Form. While transformed, you body resembles a demonic Oni in appearance, and you gain the following benefits:

items: At the start of each turn, you must expend 1 Ki Point to keep your Infernal Form active, or it immediately ends.
You can choose to grow and become Large in size.

Your hands grow into demonic claws. You can use your Wisdom, in place of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes, and when you roll a 1 or 2 on your damage roll for an unarmed strike you can reroll the die, but you must use the new roll.
Your Unarmored Defense is equal to 12 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

entries: Your transformation ends early if you fail to expend Ki at the start of your turn, if you are {@condition incapacitated}, or if you end it as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Regeneration
entries: {@i 6th-level Oni feature}

You can siphon the Ki from your foes to fuel your own vitality. Once per turn while you are in your Infernal Form and you hit a creature with a Martial Arts attack, you can choose to gain temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Malicious Step
entries: {@i 10th-level Oni feature}

You can channel the the dark Ki within your spirit to teleport closer to your would be victims. As an action, you can spend 1 Ki Point to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of a creature you can see. When you appear, you must immediately make a Martial Arts attack against it. You can make your attack with advantage and if you hit you can heal hit points equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die.

subclassFeature.name: Awakened Hellfire
entries: {@i 17th-level Oni feature}

You have mastered the infernal power that dwells within you. Your Infernal Form lasts until you choose to end it, and you don't need to expend a Ki Point at the start of each turn to maintain it. If your Infernal Form ends before you take a short or long rest however, you must spend 3 Ki points to manifest it again. Also, while you are in your Infernal Form, you gain the additional benefits below:

items: You can spend 2 Ki Points to use Malicious Step as a bonus action on your turn.
You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks and fire damage.
You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Drunken Fist
entries: Where most monks are serious and contemplative, students of the Drunken Fist seek out joy wherever they go. Masters of a style that mimics the unpredictable movements of a drunk, these monks will use their considerable skills to play the fool and make others laugh, or to embarrass haughty nobles.

subclassFeature.name: Drunken Fist Techniques
entries: {@i 3rd-level Drunken Fist feature}
You learn certain Techniques at the levels noted in the table below. They don't count against your number of Techniques Known and they cannot be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Jovial Performer
entries: {@i 3rd-level Drunken Fist feature}

You use your unique style of martial arts to bring joy with your antics. You gain proficiency in {@skill Performance}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, and with improvised weapons. Also, your attacks with improvised weapons count as Martial Arts attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Drunken Style
entries: {@i 3rd-level Drunken Fist feature}
You move about the battle with chaotic grace. On your turn, when you hit a unique creature with a Martial Arts attack, your speed increases by 5 feet until the end of that turn.
Also, when you hit a creature with a Martial Arts attack, that creature has disadvantage on any opportunity attacks it makes against you until the beginning of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Unpredictable Sway
entries: {@i 6th-level Drunken Fist feature}
Your erratic movements have become more complicated and even harder to predict. You gain the benefits listed below:

items: When you are {@condition prone} you can stand up without expending movement, rather than expending half your movement.

When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to spend 1 Ki Point and force it to attack a creature of your choice within 5 feet of you, that is also within range of its attack.

subclassFeature.name: Chaotic Luck
entries: {@i 10th-level Drunken Fist feature}

You have an almost comical way of turning the misfortunes that befall you on their head. Whenever you make an attack roll, an ability check, or saving throw with disadvantage, you can spend 1 Ki Point to cancel the disadvantage on that roll.

subclassFeature.name: Master of the Drunken Fist
entries: {@i 17th-level Drunken Fist feature}

You fly about the battle with an unparalleled level of chaos. When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can make a single Martial Arts attack against each creature you move past that is within range of your unarmed strikes, even if the number of attacks you make would exceed the normal limit.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Open Hand
entries: While all monks are warriors, monks who follow the Way of the Open Hand train relentlessly, forging their bodies into deadly weapons. They do not neglect spiritual training, but disciples of the Open Hand pride themselves on their skill with martial arts, and it is exceptionally rare to see an Open Hand monk who wields a weapon other than their fists.

subclassFeature.name: Open Hand Techniques
entries: {@i 3rd-level Open Hand feature}

You learn certain Techniques at the monk levels noted in the table below. These don't count against your total number of Techniques Known. Moreover, when you gain a monk level, you can replace one strike Technique you learned through this feature with another strike Technique of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Practiced Strikes
entries: {@i 3rd-level Open Hand feature}
Your discipline has made strikes second nature to you. Once per turn when you hit with an unarmed strike, you can use a strike Technique you know without spending a Ki Point.
You can use your strike Techniques in this way a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses each time you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Ebb and Flow
entries: {@i 6th-level Open Hand feature}
You have trained to redirect your enemy's momentum against them. When a creature you can see misses you with a melee attack, you can use one of the following reactions:

items: You force it to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it is knocked {@condition prone} and has its speed reduced to 0 until the end of its turn. Any creature that is at least one size larger than you has advantage on its saving throw.
You can make one unarmed strike against the creature.

subclassFeature.name: Open Hand Strike
entries: {@i 10th-level Open Hand feature}

Your fists strike with such force as to disrupt the flow of your foe's Ki. When you score a critical hit with an unarmed strike, the creature has disadvantage on any saving throw that you force it to make as part of that unarmed strike attack.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Many Forms
entries: {@i 10th-level Open Hand feature}
